mods.note: ~ - — © No. of 1353 Office of the Adviser to the Governnient, Bahrain. Dated, R/Thany 27. 1353 August 9, 1934. MAMQjrtANxiJii. In reference to your enquiry, the Superintendent of Police informs me that on the occasion of the arrival at Bahrain of Shaikh Muhammad bin Easa al-Khalifah anl Shaikh Abdullah bin Easa al-Khalifah, thirteen saluting guns were fired, being, four guns for Shaikh Muhammad four guns for Shaikh Abdullah Eive guns for Shaikh Sulman bin Hamad al-Khalifah who proceeded to the mail steamer to greet these two gentlemen. ^ \ H. B. M ! s Political Agent, Bahrain. and Adviser to the Government. DC/N.y / (J> Section. 6/67 FUe No. Heading. NOTES. Serial No. Pl'09. 19 . Nog, Subject. He. Salutes to the Huler of Bahrein and other Chiefs and notables. Notes and Orders. iSeen, File.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/67 Salutes to the Ruler of Bahrain and Chiefs and notables'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from Claud Cranbrook Lewis De Grenier, acting Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, to the Political Agent, Bahrain, Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch. The letter is dated 9 August 1934 and reports the number of saluting guns fired by the State Police upon the arrival at Bahrain of Shaikh Muhammad bin Easa al-Khalifah [Shaikh Muḥammad bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah] and Shaikh Abdullah bin Easa al-Khalifah [Shaikh ‘Abdullah bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah].Folios 4-5 are internal office notes.
